html: 8.10.17  9:10 pm   Hi! So I just started learning guitar a couple months ago, and I'm still very much a beginner. One thing I'm trying to do to get a better "ear" for music is to pick out little patterns and phrases and stuff that catches my attention. There's this one thing that I hear all the time... I heard that one Charlie Puth song, One Call Away, on the radio today. Towards the end of the song (starting at around 2:19 in the album version, not the music video) when he does like a stripped down, variation of the chorus he sings the line "nothing on me" and he adds this little twist that makes it sound different than the other choruses in the song. Like he adds some kind of extra chord or something. I'm drawing a blank on other specific songs I've heard something almost exactly like this, but I know it's something I hear very often in a lot of music, especially pop and R&B type stuff. I can't seem to figure out exactly what's going on though, or what the little cho rd varia tion thing is. Can you maybe help me out on this?

html:
8.10.17  6:42 pm   Got any tips for "soloing over chord changes"? Pretty much all the videos/tutorials for this kind of thing I've seen online are all just saying "use this mode over this scale degree" and/or "highlight the chord tones." Which, yea, that works... But, I don't really like looking at playing music in this kind of way. Whenever I improvise/solo I try to base what I'm playing around the main melody (kind of like a 'theme and variation' type of thing).

     I think when you're improvising, you shouldn't be thinking about scales and stuff, you should be thinking about the melody and harmony of the song.

      But, honestly, looking for work as a musician, being able to improvise off of a lead sheet is a good skill to have. I know there's a lot of gigs out there where you just kind of flip through the 'Real Book' and take turns comping/soloing over whatever song you happen to turn the page to. If somebody put a piece of sheet music in front of you that you've never hear d or pla yed before, how would you put together a solo that sounds good/interesting to you? Can you sight read the melody, but instead of playing the melody you're reading, come up with a variation of that melody on the spot as you're reading it for the first time? That seems really difficult.

But, I don't really like looking at playing music in this kind of way. Whenever I improvise/solo I try to base what I'm playing around the main melody (kind of like a 'theme and variation' type of thing).

     I think when you're improvising, you shouldn't be thinking about scales and stuff, you should be thinking about the melody and harmony of the song.

8.10.17  3:04 am   Why all the short erratic videos? 

     

6.15.17  5:18 am   why do you do such short, seemingly meaningless videos?

     

6.11.17  8:50 pm   You seem like a smart person that manages to mix inspiration, music, humor, and randomness in your works, and I love that. Like, it make me think "wow, when I grow up, I want to be him". So after this kinda lengthy introduction, here's my question: Why do you make your works so short? It kinda makes me sad, because it feels like you have so much potential, with all the music you make n' stuff, demonstrated in History of Japan and hotewig

     

5.20.17  2:22 pm  So why are all your other videos so...short?

     

5.19.17  1:40 pm   I've been wondering, why are some of your videos only 8 seconds long?

     

4.14.17  10:40 pm   Is there a reason why you did so many really short videos ? I really love them and hope to see more when you are done with this golgotha

     

3.16.17  9:53 pm   I love ur video, but why do they so short?

     

     starting with short projects is a good way to get started if you are feeling overwhelmed with the possibilities. i did that for a while, and then just when i was ready to move on, i accidentally got really popular on a video site that has a maximum time length of 6 and a half seconds, so i had to make even more short ones
original_html:
8.10.17  3:04 am   I really like your work especially your history videos. Your art style and how you get your points across is unique and interesting. With the video hi, i'm Steve i'm not sure what exactly your trying to say. Is there a point to the video besides set a goal and accomplish it?

      And why all the short erratic videos?

answers_original.html:
8.10.17  3:04 am   Why all the short erratic videos? 

     

6.15.17  5:18 am   why do you do such short, seemingly meaningless videos?

     

6.11.17  8:50 pm   You seem like a smart person that manages to mix inspiration, music, humor, and randomness in your works, and I love that. Like, it make me think "wow, when I grow up, I want to be him". So after this kinda lengthy introduction, here's my question: Why do you make your works so short? It kinda makes me sad, because it feels like you have so much potential, with all the music you make n' stuff, demonstrated in History of Japan and hotewig

     

5.20.17  2:22 pm  So why are all your other videos so...short?

     

5.19.17  1:40 pm   I've been wondering, why are some of your videos only 8 seconds long?

     

4.14.17  10:40 pm   Is there a reason why you did so many really short videos ? I really love them and hope to see more when you are done with this golgotha

     

3.16.17  9:53 pm   I love ur video, but why do they so short?

     

     starting with short projects is a good way to get started if you are feeling overwhelmed with the possibilities. i did that for a while, and then just when i was ready to move on, i accidentally got really popular on a video site that has a maximum time length of 6 and a half seconds, so i had to make even more short ones
